newsitem.title: USA: Hilite sees profit in full-year 1997.
newsitem.headline: Hilite sees profit in full-year 1997.

text.p: Auto parts maker Hilite Industries said on Wednesday it would rebound from a loss in the first half of fiscal 1997 and record a profit for the full year.
The company said in a statement that its specialty components and assemblies division caused Hilite's second quarter loss and would continue to harm earnings in the near term.

Hilite reported a second-quarter loss of $778,000, or $0.16 a share, against earnings of $1 million, or $0.21 a share, in the same period in 1995. It recorded a loss of $375,000, or $0.08 a share, in the first half of fiscal 1997 against a profit of $2.1 million, or $0.42 a share, in the year-before period.
"Our goal is to return the division to profitability as soon as possible," chief executive Daniel Brady said.
"The timing depends on how quickly our profit improvement efforts take effect and on the degree of cooperation we receive from our customers, particularly Ford (Motor Co)."

He added, "Based on our expectations for improvement in the specialty components and assemblies division and our outlook for improving sales for all three divisions, we believe that the company will be profitable in the second half of the year, as well as for the full 1997 fiscal year."
